docs.lead_paragraph: Health spending has slowed in many countries, bringing good news — and reasons to question many neat explanations for the trend.

headline.main: The Global Slowdown in Medical Costs
headline.print_headline: The Global Slowdown in Medical Costs

docs.abstract: The Upshot column; slow economic growth, global drug and medical advances and speedy medical research contribute to recent reduction in health care spending.
docs.snippet: Health spending has slowed in many countries, bringing good news — and reasons to question many neat explanations for the trend.

docs.lead_paragraph: While the Long Island Rail Road’s unions may feel they have the upper hand in negotiations, they may not want the public denouncing them as selfish.

headline.main: High-Stakes L.I.R.R. Threat That Works Both Ways
headline.print_headline: High-Stakes Rail Threat That Works Both Ways

docs.abstract: News analysis; threat by Long Island Rail Road’s unions to walk off the job has unusually high stakes, potentially creating havoc for tens of thousands of commuters; unions are confident they have upper hand in negotiations, but Metropolitan Transportation Authority is seizing on public’s frequent resentment toward unions to portray them as greedy.
docs.snippet: While the Long Island Rail Road’s unions may feel they have the upper hand in negotiations, they may not want the public denouncing them as selfish.

byline.original: By STEVEN GREENHOUSE and MATT FLEGENHEIMER

docs.lead_paragraph: It turns out the can’t-miss star who misses the N.B.A. can make a fair living in Algiers, or in Halifax, Canada.

headline.seo: Rucker Park Stars Set Their N.B.A. Dreams Aside and Head Abroad
headline.main: A Symbol of City Hoops, and Now Globalization
headline.print_headline: A Symbol of City Hoops, and Globalization

docs.abstract: Michael Powell Sports of The Times column; Rucker Park in the South Bronx, once a symbol of New York City hoops, has become emblematic of basketball's globalization; Zaire Taylor, a regular at Rucker, was voted most valuable player of Worcester Wolves, and recently jumped to London Lions, enjoying a comfortable globetrotting career despite having put his NBA dreams aside.
docs.snippet: It turns out the can’t-miss star who misses the N.B.A. can make a fair living in Algiers, or in Halifax, Canada.

docs.lead_paragraph: Senate Republicans blocked a bill on Wednesday aimed at restoring free contraception for women who get their health insurance from companies that object on religious grounds.

headline.main: Republicans Block Bill to Restore Contraception
headline.print_headline: Republicans Block Bill to Restore Contraception

docs.abstract: Senate Republicans block Democrat-sponsored bill intended to reverse Supreme Court ruling that closely held businesses with religious objections could deny coverage for contraception for women under Affordable Care Act.
docs.snippet: Senate Republicans blocked a bill on Wednesday aimed at restoring free contraception for women who get their health insurance from companies that object on religious grounds.

headline.main: Consumers Appear Uncertain About Connected Cars

docs.abstract: While the likes of Apple and Google have introduced operating systems for cars, people don’t appear to be interested in being connected in their cars, according to research from Telefónica.
docs.snippet: While the likes of Apple and Google have introduced operating systems for cars, people don’t appear to be interested in being connected in their cars, according to research from Telefónica.

docs.lead_paragraph: Utah's attorney general asked the U.S. Supreme Court on Wednesday for an emergency stay of an order by an appeals court to recognize hundreds of same-sex marriages performed in the state pending an appeal.

headline.main: Utah Asks Supreme Court to Stay Ruling on Recognizing Gay Marriages
headline.print_headline: Utah Asks Supreme Court to Stay Ruling on Recognizing Gay Marriages

docs.lead_paragraph: The Republican effort to sue President Barack Obama over his use of executive powers got under way in Congress on Wednesday at a hearing where lawmakers and constitutional law experts bickered over the move in a taste of the politicking to come.

headline.main: U.S. Lawmakers, Lawyers Argue Over House Republican Plan to Sue Obama
headline.print_headline: U.S. Lawmakers, Lawyers Argue Over House Republican Plan to Sue Obama

docs.snippet: The Republican effort to sue President Barack Obama over his use of executive powers got under way in Congress on Wednesday at a hearing where lawmakers and constitutional law experts bickered over the move in a taste of the politicking to come.

docs.lead_paragraph: The GOP-controlled House passed a $20 billion measure Wednesday that would slash budgets for enforcing tax laws and new financial regulations, and a healthy food initiative that's a pet cause of first lady Michelle Obama.

headline.main: House Passes $20B Bill Cutting IRS Tax Enforcement
headline.print_headline: House Passes $20B Bill Cutting IRS Tax Enforcement

docs.snippet: The GOP-controlled House passed a $20 billion measure Wednesday that would slash budgets for enforcing tax laws and new financial regulations, and a healthy food initiative that's a pet cause of first lady Michelle Obama.
